posts.post_content:
I for one like this card! I liked it more when it came out the first time... don't really want anymore now that I have 4 in a deck already!  
  
Also, this happens to be surprisingly good in the deck I built around it... Not AMAZING but I have won turn 4 several times and averages about a turn 6-7 win (assuming it's not destroyed). Uses a ton of searchers including lots of transmute cards. Lots of fun :)

Posted By: pedrodyl (7/5/2012 9:18:07 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Finally, a happy reprinting! (This and Akroma's Memorial...)  
  
I LOVE putting this in my deck. I've used it all of... 2? times, but it's fun to have anyway.  
I'm a gimmick-player, so I don't stupidly focus on winning with it. I usually run a 250+ card deck (and because of how my collection is, it's mostly singleton), and only have one copy of this. So I figure that if I can happen to draw it and play it, that's just fine. Heck, the first time I used it, it just got countered anyway.  
  
That other comment though... how could this possibly work into Commander/EDH? Isn't that limited to EXACTLY 100 cards, a bit short of the 207-card minimum needed to use this? (if on turn one)
posts.html:
Finally, a happy reprinting! (This and Akroma's Memorial...)

I LOVE putting this in my deck. I've used it all of... 2? times, but it's fun to have anyway.
I'm a gimmick-player, so I don't stupidly focus on winning with it. I usually run a 250+ card deck (and because of how my collection is, it's mostly singleton), and only have one copy of this. So I figure that if I can happen to draw it and play it, that's just fine. Heck, the first time I used it, it just got countered anyway.

That other comment though... how could this possibly work into Commander/EDH? Isn't that limited to EXACTLY 100 cards, a bit short of the 207-card minimum needed to use this? (if on turn one)

posts.post_content:
And that's when I played [Omniscience](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Omniscience)! :D  
  
And that's when I lost all my friends! :D  
  
Casting Battle of Wits in Standard: 5 blue mana.  
Casting Omniscience in Standard: 10 blue mana.  
Casting 200+ spells for FREE off of 4x [Boundless Realms](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boundless Realms) fairly ramping your [Demonic Revelation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Demonic Revelation)?? Priceless.  
  
EDIT: I drafted a foil one of this. After going in thinking I was going to build a nice Red-Green creature beats deck for two and a half packs, I got passed a Battle of Wits and I cursed because I knew how the night was going to end. I resigned myself to the inevitable.   
  
I picked the best cards I could for my 40 from what I had (got no rares I could really use actually so the deck I was about to run wasn't very good anyway- that's what makes this story a little better, lol)  
  
And I set aside 200 Islands and my two Battle of Wits (somebody later told me they passed me the foil one over Ajani, Caller of the Pride. I wasn't going to be winnin... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
The main reason I like this card is that it sets up a BADASS meter.  
  
Oh, you can be all efficient and win with this here enchantment with a near-200 card deck. But why stop there?  
  
Win with a 400 card deck. Go on. For every 100 cards, there is one Battle of Wits. Do it. You'll be a badass. Happy digging :D
posts.html:

Posted By: Blackworm_Bloodworm (8/25/2012 4:46:15 PM)

posts.post_content:
I use this as a legitimate wincon in my [Phelddagrif](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phelddagrif) EDH deck with [Spawnsire of Ulamog](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spawnsire of Ulamog). Just get Spawnsire off, grab all my common Eldrazis (I keep them set aside just for the occasion, I have 167, I think) and drop [Terminus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terminus). I also run [Leyline of Anticipation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Leyline of Anticipation) to allow me to do this all just before my turn.  
I've never pulled the combo off, and most of my friends don't even know it's in the deck, or about all those Eldrazi I keep set aside. Some day I'll do it. Some day the hilarious Group Hug deck will suddenly combo win out of nowhere with Battle of Wits.
posts.html:
